addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable S
r
Francis Walsingham knight Principall Secretary to her Ma
tie
.

20
Janu
ary
1588
From M
r
Bodeley
P
Answers to Instructions not liked. all points denied.
States
stand affected to breake of.

page.lettertext:
It may please yo
r
H. I have newly receaved
e states answear to all mine Instructions, w
ch
I
have not
e leasure to gett copied out, to send w
t
this dispatche: but I shall by
e next, and w
t
all
some replie, suche as I shall finde behoofull to be
made againe from me. I did not thinke that
they would have passed their boundes so farre, as
to answear her
Ma
tie
w
t
undecent and malepert
termes: wherein they offend in sundrie places, besides
that they yeld to nothing requested. In effect I
am fully persuaded, that ether they determine to
breake of w
t
her Ma
tie
Uppon some newe deseigne,
at
e chiefest of them have made to them selves, or
they thinke her Hig
nes
so muche interested in
e cause,
as nothing will persuade her to leave them un-
assisted. Of
Barnevelt,
by whome they
are strangely ruled and overruled, I will shewe
yo
r
H. my opinion, Uppon further triall, lest I should
seeme by reason of my smalle aboade and experience
in this place, to come on too fast w
t
my verdict.
From
e Hage. 20 Ja
n
88.
Yo
r
H. most humbly bound Tho. Bodley.
